definition: to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: These words referred to a dog when I wrote them, but re-reading them now I began to fret.
sentences.chinese: 可现在，当我重新阅读它们时，我开始烦躁不已。

sentences.english: He was hotted up by her constant chatter.
sentences.chinese: 她的喋喋不休令他烦躁不安。

sentences.english: It's very bothersome and makes me very irritable.
sentences.chinese: 这是非常扰民，使我非常烦躁。

sentences.english: A long tale gives a child fidgets.
sentences.chinese: 太长的故事会使小孩烦躁不安。

sentences.english: I start to fret about the boycott each morning over coffee and I keep up the worrying until bedtime.
sentences.chinese: 我开始从早到晚为抵制计划感到烦躁不安。

sentences.english: After about a year, I became restless.
sentences.chinese: 大约一年之后，我开始有些烦躁。

sentences.english: In fact, I know that because of what he is and fidgety .
sentences.chinese: 其实我也知道自己是因为什么而烦躁。

sentences.english: He was uncharacteristically upset and wanted to come home from school.
sentences.chinese: 他非同一般的烦躁并希望马上从学校回家。

sentences.english: Mr Utterson came home to his bachelor house in sombre spirits.
sentences.chinese: 厄塔森先生回到他那单身汉的家里，心情烦躁。

sentences.english: I know you’ve been upset lately.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你近来一直很烦躁。

sentences.english: Chafing and choking with rage; like cords were the veins on his temples.
sentences.chinese: 因愤怒而烦躁以至哽噎，额头上青筋暴出如同绳索。

sentences.english: Recently, dad is tending to fidget, I know something wrong will happen.
sentences.chinese: 阿爸这几天有些烦躁，我知道会有事情发生。

sentences.english: He looked even more irritated than usual, especially when he saw Cal.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去比平时更烦躁，尤其是看到了卡巴顿。

sentences.english: "Temper dysregulation with dysphoria" is the work group's proposed solution.
sentences.chinese: “脾气调节障碍烦躁型”是工作组提议的解决办法。

sentences.english: Stephen was thrashing about in bed with a high temperature.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬因为高烧在床上烦躁不安地翻来翻去。

definition: lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
to feel agitated/to be troubled/to be annoyed/an upset or distraction
to feel oppressed/to be depressed/to feel dejected
